intro: Diplotaxis virgata, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features basal leaves that are elongated and covered in fine hairs, and it produces yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
